1964 Tour de France - Index 0: Stage 1 of the 1964 Tour de France took place on 22 June, spanning 215 km (134 mi) from Rennes to Lisieux. This plain stage was won by Edward Sels (BEL).
1964 Tour de France - Index 1: Stage 2 of the 1964 Tour de France occurred on 23 June, covering 208 km (129 mi) from Lisieux to Amiens. This plain stage was won by André Darrigade (FRA).
1964 Tour de France - Index 5: Stage 5 of the 1964 Tour de France was held on 26 June, with a route of 161 km (100 mi) from Metz to Freiburg. This plain stage was won by Willy Derboven (BEL).
1964 Tour de France - Index 6: Stage 6 of the 1964 Tour de France took place on 27 June, spanning 200 km (120 mi) from Freiburg to Besançon. This plain stage was won by Henk Nijdam (NED).
1964 Tour de France - Index 7: Stage 7 of the 1964 Tour de France occurred on 28 June, covering 195 km (121 mi) from Besançon to Thonon-les-Bains. This plain stage was won by Jan Janssen (NED).
1964 Tour de France - Index 8: Stage 8 of the 1964 Tour de France was held on 29 June, with a route of 249 km (155 mi) from Thonon-les-Bains to Briançon. This stage included mountains and was won by Federico Bahamontes (ESP).
1964 Tour de France - Index 9: Stage 9 of the 1964 Tour de France took place on 30 June, spanning 239 km (149 mi) from Briançon to Monaco. This mountain stage was won by Jacques Anquetil (FRA).
1964 Tour de France - Index 11: Stage 10B of the 1964 Tour de France occurred on 1 July, covering 21 km (13 mi) from Hyères to Toulon. This individual time trial was won by Jacques Anquetil (FRA).
1964 Tour de France - Index 12: Stage 11 of the 1964 Tour de France was held on 2 July, with a route of 250 km (160 mi) from Toulon to Montpellier. This plain stage was won by Edward Sels (BEL).
1964 Tour de France - Index 15: Stage 14 of the 1964 Tour de France took place on 6 July, spanning 186 km (116 mi) from Andorra to Toulouse. This mountain stage was won by Edward Sels (BEL).
1964 Tour de France - Index 16: Stage 15 of the 1964 Tour de France occurred on 7 July, covering 203 km (126 mi) from Toulouse to Luchon. This mountain stage was won by Raymond Poulidor (FRA).
1964 Tour de France - Index 20: Stage 19 of the 1964 Tour de France was held on 11 July, with a route of 215 km (134 mi) from Bordeaux to Brive. This plain stage was won by Edward Sels (BEL).
1964 Tour de France - Index 22: Stage 21 of the 1964 Tour de France took place on 13 July, spanning 311 km (193 mi) from Clermont-Ferrand to Orléans. This plain stage was won by Jean Stablinski (FRA).
1964 Tour de France - Index 23: Stage 22A of the 1964 Tour de France occurred on 14 July, covering 119 km (74 mi) from Orléans to Versailles. This plain stage was won by Benoni Beheyt (BEL).
1964 Tour de France - Index 24: Stage 22B of the 1964 Tour de France was held on 14 July, with a route of 27 km (17 mi) from Versailles to Paris. This individual time trial was won by Jacques Anquetil (FRA).
